DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Develop Internet-based application allow pediatric patient cancer enter virtual community follow capability : - Interact classmates participate classroom activity via e-mail , chat group , online field trip , art studio , music room , game room - Identify interact community peer similar medical condition - Access dictionary get medical information understandable term - Interact medical community online - Interact family member online - Determine acceptability program among group patient classmate , teacher , family member , healthcare provider use focus group . - Determine effect program self-esteem , cop behavior , perceive social support , cancer-relevant medical knowledge , feeling control health destiny patient . - Determine effect program performance patient school . - Determine effect program alleviate psychological distress patient . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . - Phase I : Students , family member , teacher , health provider participate focus group provide system design implementation input assess overall acceptability prototype Internet-based application pediatric cancer patient . - Phase II : Patients assign 1 2 group , base participate center . - Group 1 : Patients access utilize Internet-based application @ neWorld . - Group 2 : Patients access utilize @ neWorld . In group , patient complete questionnaire measure psychological distress , quality life , self-esteem , cop behavior , perceive academic social competence , perceive social support , cancer-relevant medical knowledge , feeling control health destiny , utilization psychological service , performance school baseline 3 6 month . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 94 patient ( 44 group 1 50 group 2 ) accrue study .
